page.title: 11DRINKSTONE MILLS
page.content: In Drinkstone there are two windmills. The Post mill, built in 1689, is the oldest. The Roundhouse is brick and stone. There are two common sails, two spring sails, and a fantail. There used to be a sack sewing machine, a circular saw and a reciprocating saw, all worked by wind. The Postmill was worked, sometimes by wind, sometimes by diesel engine, until 1972. There is a story that there were two millers who had an argument. They both wanted to own the mill. So one built the Smock mill for himself. The Smock mill was built on the site of an ancient horse mill. You can't go up the Smock mill because the wood might break. The sails are gone. The mills have belonged to the Clover family for generations. Miss Clover lets us visit whenever we ask her.
